// In your MessageTask's onPostExecute method
@Override
protected void onPostExecute(List<String> list) {
    int oldCount = adapter.getCount();
    adapter.clear();
    adapter.addAll(list);
    adapter.notifyDataSetChanged();
    if (list.size() > oldCount) {
        listview.setSelection(oldCount); // maintain scroll position
        // show notification for new message
        NotificationCompat.Builder builder = new NotificationCompat.Builder(this)
                .setSmallIcon(R.drawable.notification_icon)
                .setContentTitle("New Message")
                .setContentText("You have a new message in the chat");
        NotificationManager manager = (NotificationManager) getSystemService(Context.NOTIFICATION_SERVICE);
        manager.notify(0, builder.build());
    }
}
<<<explanation>>>: In the onPostExecute method of your AsyncTask, you first get the old count of messages in the adapter. Then you clear the adapter and add all messages from the list. After that, you notify the adapter that the data has changed. If the size of the list is greater than the old count, it means there are new messages. In this case, you set the selection of the ListView to the old count to maintain the scroll position. Then you create a notification to notify the user about the new message.
